messages.content:
You are a research assistant with access to a memory system. Your task is to answer the user's question by searching and retrieving information from memory.

Instructions:
- Use memory_search to find relevant information for the question.
- Use memory_retrieve to get full document details when you need specifics.
- Use memory_capabilities to understand what the memory system offers, including available search modes, filter fields, and any extra tools.
- If extra tools are available (e.g. batch_retrieve), prefer them for efficiency — they can fetch multiple documents in one call instead of one call per document.
- Synthesize your findings into a clear, concise answer.
- IMPORTANT: For each claim in your answer, cite the supporting episode using the format [ref_id]. Every factual statement must have at least one citation.
- If you cannot find sufficient information, say so clearly.
- You have a limited number of turns and tool calls. Use them efficiently.
Based on the first few days of logs, are there any service health patterns emerging?

messages.reasoning: We need to answer: "Based on the first few days of logs, are there any service health patterns emerging?" We need to search memory for logs, service health patterns, first few days. Use memory_search.

PREFER this over calling memory_retrieve multiple times. Valid ref_ids: 'compaction_summary' (the full summary), or original episode IDs cited in the summary (e.g. 'scope_01_ep_005').", "parameters": {"type": "object", "properties": {"ref_ids": {"type": "array", "items": {"type": "string"}, "description": "List of reference IDs to retrieve."}}, "required": ["ref_ids"]}}]}

{"ref_id": "cascading_failure_01_ep_001", "text": "## 2024-01-15 Daily Operations Summary

### Endpoint Performance
- /checkout: REQUESTS 118240 | p50: 92ms p95: 210ms p99: 320ms | err: 0.12% (142 errors) | success: 99.88%
- /fraud_check: REQUESTS 117980 | p50: 68ms p95: 160ms p99: 240ms | err: 0.08% (96 errors) | success: 99.92%
- /geo_lookup: REQUESTS 116420 | p50: 55ms p95: 130ms p99: 180ms | err: 0.05% (58 errors) | success: 99.95%
- /auth: REQUESTS 152300 | p50: 28ms p95: 70ms p99: 110ms | err: 0.04% (61 errors) | success: 99.96%
- /product_catalog: REQUESTS 204800 | p50: 34ms p95: 88ms p99: 140ms | err: 0.05% (105 errors) | success: 99.95%
- /search: REQUESTS 176500 | p50: 48ms p95: 120ms p99: 190ms | err: 0.09% (159 errors) | success: 99.91%
- /recommendations: REQUESTS 145900 | p50: 52ms p95: 140ms p99: 220ms | err: 0.1% (146 errors) | success: 99.9%

### Infrastructure
- gateway-01: CPU 34% | Mem 58% | Disk 61% | Conns: 1820 | Net: 420/510 Mbps
- gateway-02: CPU 32% | Mem 56% | Disk 60% | Conns: 1755 | Net: 405/498 Mbps
- service-b-01: CPU 29% | Mem 54% | Disk 57% | Conns: 980 | Net: 210/240 Mbps
- metrics-db-01: CPU 22% | Mem 66% | Disk 78% | Conns: 220 | Net: 90/110 Mbps

### Connection Pools
- primary: active 68 | idle 132 | waiting 0 | exhaustion: 0 | max: 200 | avg_wait: 2ms
- replica: active 34 | idle 66 | waiting 0 | exhaustion: 0 | max: 100 | avg_wait: 1ms
- third_party_geo: active 22 | idle 38 | waiting 0 | exhaustion: 0 | max: 60 | avg_wait: 3ms

### CDN & Caching
- Hit rate: 94.1% | Bandwidth: 6.2 Gbps | Origin requests: 312400

### Alerts
- [warning] DISK-USAGE-WARN on metrics-db-01: disk_pct=78
- [info] CERT-EXPIRY-30D on gateway-01: api.example.com 30d

### Deployments & Changes
- Deployed auth-service v2.3.1

### Events
- CDN cache hit rate 94.1%
- A/B test 'checkout-v2' at 15% rollout
- Rotated gateway access logs to new bucket policy
- Scheduled metrics-db cleanup window 2024-01-16 02:00Z

### On-Call
- shift handoff note: Shift: J. Martinez. 0 pages. 1 ticket (DISK-4421 cleanup). Quiet shift.", "metadata": {"episode_type": "signal", "phase": "baseline", "signal_density": "none"}}

function.name: memory_search
function.description: Search the memory system for relevant information. Available search modes: compaction.

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return. Default: 1.

function.name: memory_retrieve
function.description: Retrieve a full document by its reference ID.

ref_id.description: The reference ID of the document to retrieve.

function.name: memory_capabilities
function.description: Get the capability manifest describing what the memory system offers.

function.name: batch_retrieve
function.description: Retrieve multiple documents by their reference IDs in a single call. PREFER this over calling memory_retrieve multiple times. Valid ref_ids: 'compaction_summary' (the full summary), or original episode IDs cited in the summary (e.g. 'scope_01_ep_005').

ref_ids.description: List of reference IDs to retrieve.

message.reasoning: We need to answer: "Based on the first few days of logs, are there any service health patterns emerging?" First few days likely refer to early logs: 2024-01-15, 2024-01-16, 2024-01-17. Need to identify patterns: error rates, latency, resource usage, alerts. Let's retrieve full summaries for those three days (ep_001, ep_002, ep_003). Use batch_retrieve.
